content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <codeBook xsi:schemaLocation="ddi:codebook:2_5 http://www.ddialliance.org/Specification/DDI-Codebook/2.5/XMLSchema/codebook.xsd" version="2.5" xmlns="ddi:codebook:2_5" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">   <docDscr>     <citation>       <titlStmt>         <titl>DDI2.5 XML CODEBOOK RECORD FOR STUDY NUMBER 851737</titl>       </titlStmt>       <prodStmt>         <prodDate></prodDate>       </prodStmt>     </citation>   </docDscr>   <stdyDscr>     <citation>       <titlStmt>         <titl>Mounted police community patrols</titl>         <IDNo agency="UKDA">851737</IDNo>         <IDNo agency="datacite">10.5255/UKDA-SN-851737</IDNo>       </titlStmt>       <rspStmt>         <AuthEnty>Ben Bradford, University of Oxford</AuthEnty>       </rspStmt>       <prodStmt>         <copyright>Ben Bradford, University of Oxford</copyright>         <copyright>Giacomantonio Chris, RAND Europe</copyright>         <fundAg>ESRC</fundAg>         <grantNo>ES/L001918/1</grantNo>       </prodStmt>       <distStmt>         <depositr>Ben Bradford, University of Oxford</depositr>         <distDate date="2015-03-12T00:00:00Z">12 March 2015</distDate>       </distStmt>       <verStmt>         <version date="2015-03-12T00:00:00Z">Rvs31</version>       </verStmt>       <holdings URI="http://dx.doi.org/10.5255/UKDA-SN-851737" />     </citation>     <stdyInfo>       <subject>         <keyword>POLICE ACTIVITIES</keyword>         <keyword>POLICE-COMMUNITY RELATIONSHIP</keyword>         <keyword>TRUST</keyword>         <keyword>2015</keyword>         <topcClas>Law, crime and legal systems</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>This data collection contains two different datasets. The first dates relates to a telephone survey of local residents in six areas that formed the test and control sites in a quasi-experiment that tested the effect of mounted police community patrols on public 'trust and confidence' in the police. The second dataset pertains to a programme of Systematic Social Observation of mounted and foot police patrols in the same areas and also other police districts. Files relating to the two datasets are included in different zip folders</abstract>       <sumDscr>         <collDate event="start" date="2014-04-30T00:00:00Z">30 April 2014</collDate>         <collDate event="end" date="2014-09-30T00:00:00Z">30 September 2014</collDate>         <nation>United Kingdom</nation>         <geogCover>Gloucestershire, London, Lancashire</geogCover>         <anlyUnit>events and processes</anlyUnit>         <anlyUnit>individuals</anlyUnit>         <dataKind>Alpha-numeric</dataKind>         <dataKind>Numeric</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <collMode>Two data collection methods were used. The telephone survey used standard survey methods to collect public opinion and experiential data. The systematic social observation used a bespoke mobile phone app to collect data on the quantity and quality of interactions between members of the public and police in community patrol settings.</collMode>         <sources />       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <contact><a href="mailto:ben.bradford@crim.ox.ac.uk">Ben Bradford, University of Oxford</a></contact>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat />   </stdyDscr> </codeBook>
